atm.controller

Class DatabaseController

  • java.lang.Object
    • atm.controller.DatabaseController

  • public class DatabaseController
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the DatabaseController that we use to interact with the database.
    Since:
    2015-03-25
    Author:
    Chris Wells

    • Method Detail

      • getAccounts

        public java.util.List<Results> getAccounts()
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                           java.lang.Exception
        The getAccounts function gets all the accounts associated with the user's swiped card and the PIN entered.
        Returns:
        accounts that are associated with the user
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - for the SQL query
        java.lang.Exception - for the account call

      • getPicture

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getPicture(java.lang.Object account,
                                               java.lang.String PIN)
                                        throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                               java.sql.SQLException,
                                               java.io.IOException
        The getPicture function allows the system to access the camera on the ATM and take a picture of the user.
        Parameters:
        account - the account information associated with the user
        PIN - the PIN the user entered upon logging in
        Returns:
        the image of the user
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - for the class check
        java.sql.SQLException - for the SQL query
        java.io.IOException - for the IO exception

      • setPicture

        public void setPicture(java.lang.Object account,
                       java.lang.String PIN,
                       java.awt.image.BufferedImage picture)
                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                       java.lang.Exception
        The setPicture function allows the system to use the picture that was taken and set it for the user's session. This is a photo of the user who is using the ATM and card/PIN that is associated to the accounts.
        Parameters:
        account - the account the user is interacting with
        PIN - the PIN that the user entered while logging in
        picture - the picture of the user
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - for the SQL query
        java.lang.Exception - for the account call

      • validate_user

        public int validate_user(java.lang.Object account,
                         java.lang.String PIN)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException,
                         java.lang.Exception
        The validate_user function validates the information that is entered (card information from the swiped card, and the PIN entered from the user) against the database to verify that the information matches in order to look at the associated accounts.
        Parameters:
        account - the accounts associated with the user
        PIN - the PIN they entered after swiping card
        Returns:
        zero if the account is not found, and a 1+ if the account is found
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - for the SQL query
        java.lang.Exception - for the account call

      • deposit

        public int deposit(java.lang.Integer account,
                   double amount)
            throws java.sql.SQLException,
                   java.lang.Exception
        The deposit function allows the user the ability to deposit money into a specified account. This function is not in use.
        Parameters:
        account - the account which the money will be deposited to
        amount - of money that will be deposited
        Returns:
        int for the response
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - for the SQL query
        java.lang.Exception - for the account call

      • withdrawl

        public boolean withdrawl(java.lang.Integer account,
                         double d)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException,
                         java.lang.Exception
        The withdraw function allows a user to withdraw funds from a selected account.
        Parameters:
        account - the account with they would like to withdraw from
        d - the amount they would like to withdraw
        Returns:
        boolean on if the withdraw was successful
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - for the SQL query
        java.lang.Exception - for the account call

      • transfer

        public boolean transfer(java.lang.Integer fromAccountNum,
                        java.lang.Integer toAccountNum,
                        double amount)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException,
                        java.lang.Exception
        The transfer function allows a user to transfer money from one account to another.
        Parameters:
        fromAccountNum - the from account
        toAccountNum - the to account
        amount - the amount in which to transfer
        Returns:
        boolean on if the transfer was successful
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for the account call
        java.sql.SQLException - for the SQL query
